ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course is good for students who want to know many algorithms and statistics methods applied in bioinformatics, biostatistics and biotechnology. The context is really abundent.
This class is quite useful and insightful!

This course offers comprehensive view of important development in bioinformatics and stat genetics. But due to its comprehensiveness, it is unable to go into details for most of the topics, students must rely on course reading to further strengthen their understanding.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  Hongyu is a very good instructor. He is knowledgeable and can explain complex problems in a much easier way. Also, his homework load is perfect. The only problem is that many questions in the homework are not well- explained in the class. So it took me a long time to figure it out by myself.
Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  I love Prof. Zhao's class so much!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is a very good course and more students should select this one.
Yes, I will recommend it to other students.
